biospec_descr.textblock:
Plasmatic levels of NT proBNP and pre pro endothelin are monitored in ARDS group to
      determine whether these biomarkers can help detect right ventricular dysfunction.

brief_summary.textblock:
Acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and mechanical ventilation can lead to right
      ventricular dysfunction and ultimately right ventricular failure by increasing pulmonary
      vascular resistances and pressure load. This can be prevented by modifying ventilator
      settings, using vasopressors or inotropes or even by prone positionning.But to do so, right
      ventricular dysfonction has to be detected. Echocardiography has emerged as a first line
      tool to diagnose right heart failure. Recently, strain analysis showed promising results to
      detect early right ventricle abnormalities in other settings such as pulmonary hypertension
      or scleroderma. We therefore decided to determine whether 2D strain could help detect early
      right ventricular dysfunction in ARDS.

clinical_study.brief_title: Detection of Right Ventricular Dysfunction by 2D Strain During Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrom (ARDS)

criteria.textblock:
ARDS group

        Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Need for mechanical ventilation

          -  ARDS criteria met: Respiratory failure not fully explained by cardiac failure,
             Pao2/FiO2<200, bilateral opacities on Chest imaging, all symptoms appeared within 1
             week

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Predictable duration of mechanical ventilation shorter than 48 hours

          -  Contraindication to transesophageal echocardiography

        ALI group:

        Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Need for mechanical ventilation

          -  ALI criteria met: Respiratory failure not fully explained by cardiac failure,
             Pao2/FiO2<300, bilateral opacities on Chest imaging, all symptoms appeared within 1
             week

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Predictable duration of mechanical ventilation shorter than 48 hours

        Control Group:

        Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Need for mechanical ventilation for a non-respiratory cause

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Need for FiO2>30%

          -  Known cardiac abnormalities

          -  Cardiac drugs intake during last 24 hours

study_pop.textblock: Patients are recruited in our medical intensive care unit at Grenoble University Hospital.

clinical_study.official_title: Detection of Right Ventricular Dysfunction by 2D Strain During Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrom (ARDS)

oversight_info.authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé

primary_outcome.description: We will assess whether 2D strain can detect a right ventricular dysfunction as compared to standard echocardiographic parameters

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: We measure right ventricle strain (RV strain) in patients under mechanical ventilation for a non-respiratory cause. This allows us to determine the mean value of RV strain under ventilation when there is no respiratory failure.
secondary_outcome.measure: Mean right ventricle strain under ventilated patients

secondary_outcome.description: In ARDS patients, we record a transthoracic and transesophageal echocardiography. We compare RV strain values obtained from transthoracic and transesophageal echocardiography.
secondary_outcome.measure: Reproducibility between transthoracic and transesophageal strain measures

secondary_outcome.description: These assays are made based on the hypothesis they could help discriminate between  patients who will develop a right ventricular dysfunction from those who will not. A blood sample is withdrawn at the same time as echocardiography only in the ARDS group.
secondary_outcome.measure: NT pro BNP and pre pro endothelin plasma level
